title_sort: louisa van velsor whitman to walt whitman, [13 june 1871]
title: Louisa Van Velsor Whitman to Walt Whitman, [13 June 1871]
text: 13 June 1871tuesdayTuesday afternoonwell waltWalti will write a few lines once more before you come i got your letter on saturdaySaturday i haventhaven't heard from st louisSt. Louis since i wrote to you so i suppose they are about the same or perhaps better than when i last heard) neither have i heard from georgeyGeorgey he left some money for me to put in the bank as the bank was shut when he came from new yorkNew York after i put it in he wanted me to send him a line of the amount invested as the bank book was at the bank to have the interest cast up so i got the man to put it on a paper the whole amount and i sent it to himthere aintain't much new walterWalter dear with me i am limping around as usual the paper man is fixing the hall has been a week at it but is nearly finished i have had a real job had to take up all the stair carpitcarpet have had a woman to scrub and i hope to get it down this week georgeysGeorge's house is kept in good condition it wouldentwouldn't be if i wasentwasn't here it would soon look like a tenant house i have kept the two last months rent but have paid every cent of it on the house) and he didentdidn't give me a cent the two last times he was home he asked me if i wanted any of course i said no as he took out 30 dollars and said to his wife that had to last or asked her if it would last them a month she said they would get some from lowelLowell i said i had an order from waltWalt that would last me) but waltWalt for all that George would never sese me want i have too high an opinion of him to think he would ever shirk in any way if i was needy) but they want very much to get this house clear and i want him tooto as its a nice placewrite in your this weeks letter what day you will come walterWalterburn this letter waltWalt Louisa Van Velsor Whitman to Walt Whitman, [13 June 1871]
